10:18 <vmassol> mflorea/all: good morning. Do we have a generic solution for using a Document Sheet that displays the doc content ($doc.content) but that still allows to use {{velocity}} macro  in the content? (without causing the nested script issue)  
10:19 <mflorea> include macro  
10:19 <mflorea> {{include reference="" /}}  
10:19 <mflorea> the reference resolves to the current document  
10:19 <vmassol> "" is going to be the doc having the document sheet binding object?  
10:20 <vmassol> ah yes  
10:20 <vmassol> since $doc points to it  
10:20 <mflorea> "" is the document being displayed with the sheet  
10:20 <vmassol> thanks  
10:20 <vmassol> there's only one issue though  
10:20 <mflorea> ?  
10:20 <vmassol> but a small one  
10:20 <vmassol> viewing that sheet raises a recursive error  
10:21 <vmassol> and I'd need an #if to avoid it  
10:21 <tmortagne> mflorea: using {{include}} is not safe because it means the right of the sheet author will be used  
10:21 <mflorea> yes, indeed  
10:21 <vmassol> I guess I can use another include but it looks overkill  
10:21 <mflorea> indeed, there's a security issue with the include  
10:21 <mflorea> you have to trust the document content  
10:21 <tmortagne> ideally we could need something like {{display sheet="false"/}} that would do display on the document content  
10:22 <tmortagne> s/could/would/  
10:22 <mflorea> tmortagne: we have $services.display  
10:22 <tmortagne> yes but it produces html which is not very nice  
10:22 <mflorea> true  
10:23 <tmortagne> we need to improve ways to display and reuse content and properties, it's not so great right now  
10:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> gdelhumeau/mflorea: question for you. Any idea why I get this in a xwiki instance generated by a functional test:  
10:33 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/l/AHc5dcvEwUJAoaGWSj9KHrkVjJT5UKdXRsI
